A1.T3.table:
Symbol Description
Go⁢r⁢isubscript𝐺𝑜𝑟𝑖G_{ori}italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_r italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT The original graph without prompting
Pωsubscript𝑃𝜔P_{\omega}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ω end_POSTSUBSCRIPT Graph prompting method with parameter ω𝜔\omegaitalic_ω
C⁢(Go⁢r⁢i)𝐶subscript𝐺𝑜𝑟𝑖C(G_{ori})italic_C ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_r italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) The optimal embedding vector for the downstream task. C⁢(⋅)𝐶⋅C(\cdot)italic_C ( ⋅ ) can be understood as the optimal downstream task model
Gb⁢r⁢isubscript𝐺𝑏𝑟𝑖G_{bri}italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b italic_r italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT The bridge graph that can be used to obtain C⁢(Go⁢r⁢i)𝐶subscript𝐺𝑜𝑟𝑖C(G_{ori})italic_C ( italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o italic_r italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) using the original model
Gpsubscript𝐺𝑝G_{p}italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT The graph after prompting
Gωsubscript𝐺𝜔G_{\omega}italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ω end_POSTSUBSCRIPT The graph after prompting with parameter ω𝜔\omegaitalic_ω
ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ Represents the extent of Bridge set expansion, i.e. the “error”
n𝑛nitalic_n Generally represents the number of layers in the GNN
F𝐹Fitalic_F Represents the dimension of the graph feature vector
N𝑁Nitalic_N Represents the number of nodes in the graph
M𝑀Mitalic_M Represents the number of graphs in the dataset ΩΩ\Omegaroman_Ω
ΦΦ\Phiroman_Φ Represents the aperture of the convex cone can be understood as the maximum opening angle
